selection_rationale: With corrupted labels, reducing the variance of gradient estimates and dampening noisy updates are critical; learning rate controls step magnitude, momentum governs temporal smoothing (projected momentum in SFedAvg can filter noise), and batch size improves the signal-to-noise ratio of minibatch gradients.

configs.rationale: Conservative steps without momentum to isolate the effect of larger batches on noise robustness.
Moderate LR with moderate momentum to balance speed and noise smoothing.
Scenario-default LR and strong momentum with a larger batch than baseline to reduce gradient noise.
Slightly higher LR to test stability limits with strong momentum and moderate batch size.
Very strong momentum with baseline batch size to test whether projected momentum helps despite smaller batches.
Aggressive temporal smoothing paired with large batches to maximally suppress label-noise variance.
Low LR with strong momentum and very large batch for a highly robust, low-variance regime.
Stress-test higher LR under moderate momentum and baseline batch to probe failure/instability boundaries.

expected_improvement: Relative to the baseline, we expect smoother loss curves and +1–3% test accuracy under noise for SFedAvg, especially with (lr in [0.08,0.10], momentum ≥0.9) and batch_size ≥64, due to better variance reduction and momentum projection filtering.
